intro: Gundlachia cubana, commonly known as Cuban wild cucumber, is a climbing vine native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, pumpkins, and gourds. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into elongated, spiny fruits. Its botanical characteristics include a hairy stem and a distinct, aromatic odor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
